title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When shutting down Windows with a WSWB session open and a dirty .txt file, users should be warned about the unsaved changes and given the option to save.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Start WSWB and create a new project. 2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. 3. Notice that the text file is marked as dirty. 4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down or reboot the computer. Expected result: A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
